title: The Case of the Frightened Lady

sources.title: The Case of the Frightened Lady (1940)
sources.description: A classic British thriller set in a sinister old house, based on a story by Edgar Wallace. Watch on RetroFlix.org: https://retroflix.org/the-case-of-the-frightened-lady-1940/

sources.title: MYSTERY NIGHT AT THE BIJOU 3 (Double Feature).
sources.description: The 2am Theater reaches across the pond to merry old England for this simulated double feature program in a second-run movie house: The murderous entertainment begins with coming attractions and a cartoon. The first feature presentation is the classic Edgar Wallace old dark house mystery, "The Case of the Frightened Lady," followed by a Robert Benchley short, "Home Movies." Then the rising body count in a London lodging house baffles Scotland Yard in "Shadows on the Stairs," with a worthy ensemble cast that includes Turhan Bey in his screen debut.

sources.title: THE CASE OF THE FRIGHTENED LADY video & audio upgrade
sources.description: This print is sharper and with cleaner audio than the existing IA copy. All is not well on young Lord Lebanon's ancestral estate, what with his mother's constant nagging and the chauffeur turning up dead, in this Edgar Wallace mystery with a good cast and rising body count. (It's always amazed me our British friends were able to produce and release quality films like this during the most desperate days of the blitz.) Directed by George King UK release 1940 US release 1941 a.k.a. "The Frightened Lady" Complete print (US version) NOTE: Other recommended British films of the period which are available here at IA include "49th Parallel," "In Which We Serve," "The Way Ahead" and "We Dive at Dawn."

metadata.Writer: Edward Dryhurst (screen play by), Edgar Wallace (play)
metadata.Actors: Felix Aylmer, Patrick Barr, George Cross, Terence de Marney
